Docs.summary: Contains a read-only collection of objects for each in a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A user cannot add or remove a <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> from the collection, but can change the properties of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> corresponding to a particular <xref:System.Data.DataTable>. Adding or removing a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> from the DataSet adds or removes the corresponding <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> from the collection.

Docs.threadsafe: This type is safe for multithreaded read operations. You must synchronize any write operations.

Docs.value: The number of objects in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The number of <xref:System.Data.DataViewSetting> objects is the same as the number of <xref:System.Data.DataTable> objects in the <xref:System.Data.DataSet>.

Gets a value that indicates whether access to the is synchronized (thread-safe).
Docs.value: This property is always , unless overridden by a derived class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
Derived classes can provide a synchronized version of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection> using the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property.

Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the .
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Derived classes can provide a synchronized version of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection> using the SyncRoot property.
Program code must always perform synchronized operations on the SyncRoot of the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection>, not directly on the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection>. This guarantees the correct operation of collections that are derived from other objects. Specifically, it maintains the correct synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the <xref:System.Data.DataViewSettingCollection>.
